page.title: 08Bayswater Mill
page.content: The Bayswater Mill was a working Mill until __1910______.Now it is being converted into a house.The new windows have to be kept in the same place identicle to the original windows.Where the engine was is going to be a kitchen.Where the coal was kept for the steam engine a utility is going to be put there and above is going to be a bathroom.The floors have holes in.They were chutes where we think corn was sent down.Part of the wheel was left When they make the stairs this will hold up the stairs.One of the beams is a tree.They are going to keep this there and use it as part of the hall. They are goig to do one bathroom,two bedrooms andthe kitchen so that they can move in. In the end there will be six bedrooms, two bathrooms, one living room, one kitchen and one utility room.
